intro: Aneilema scapiflorum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests or along stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
